application_data.application_requirements:
### Application Requirements for California State University, Long Beach

**First-Time, First-Year (Freshman) Student Requirements:**

To be considered for admission as a first-time, first-year student, applicants must meet the following minimum requirements:

*   Complete the comprehensive pattern of college preparatory subject requirements (A-G courses) with a grade of "C" or higher in each course.
*   Graduate from high school or have the equivalent.
*   Have a minimum California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) eligibility index. This index is calculated based on the high school grade point average (GPA) in the A-G courses.
    *   For non-STEM majors, a minimum CSULB Index of 3,200 is required for consideration.
    *   For STEM majors, a minimum STEM Index of 3,600 is required for consideration.

Evidence for these requirements can be found on the following pages of the official university website:
*   First-Time, First-Year Student Admission Eligibility: https://www.csulb.edu/admissions/first-time-first-year-student-admission-eligibility
*   Freshmen Admissions Requirements: https://www.csulb.edu/admissions/freshmen-admissions-requirements
*   First-Time, First-Year Student Application Process: https://www.csulb.edu/admissions/first-time-first-year-student-application-process

**Transfer Student Requirements:**

To be considered for admission as a transfer student, applicants must meet the following minimum requirements:

*   Have completed at least 60 transferable semester units or 90 transferable quarter units.
*   Have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher in all transferable college coursework attempted.
*   Be in good standing at the last college or university attended.
*   Complete the following four foundational courses ("Golden Four") with a grade of "C" or better:
    *   Oral Communication
    *   Written Communication
    *   Critical Thinking
    *   College-Level Mathematics
*   Meet major-specific admission requirements, which may include specific coursework and a higher GPA.

Evidence for these requirements can be found on the following pages of the official university website:
*   Transfer Admissions Requirements: https://www.csulb.edu/admissions/transfer-admissions-requirements
*   Transfer Students: https://www.csulb.edu/admissions/transfer-students
*   Transfer Admission Eligibility: https://www.csulb.edu/admissions/transfer-admission-eligibility

**Graduate Student Requirements:**

To be considered for admission to a graduate program, applicants must meet the following minimum university-level requirements:

*   Hold an acceptable baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution, or have completed equivalent academic preparation as determined by the appropriate campus authorities.
*   Be in good academic standing at the last college or university attended.
*   Have a minimum GPA of 2.5 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units attempted. Some programs may have higher GPA requirements.

It is important to note that individual graduate programs have their own specific admission requirements, which may include:
*   Graduate Record Examinations (GRE) or Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) scores.
*   Letters of recommendation.
*   A statement of purpose or personal statement.
*   A professional resume or curriculum vitae.

Applicants must apply through Cal State Apply.

Evidence for these requirements can be found on the following pages of the official university website:
*   Graduate Admissions Requirements: https://www.csulb.edu/admissions/graduate-admissions-requirements
*   Graduate Programs Admission Eligibility: https://www.csulb.edu/admissions/graduate-programs-admission-eligibility
*   Graduate Admissions: https://www.csulb.edu/graduate-studies/graduate-admissions

Not Required.

application_data.additional_information:
Some applicants to California State University, Long Beach are required to submit additional information beyond the standard application. The specific requirements vary depending on the applicant type and intended major.

**For transfer students,** a supplemental application is required after the initial Cal State Apply application. This online application is specific to the student's intended major and requires a detailed review and confirmation of their academic record.

**Certain majors have additional requirements:**

*   **Freshmen** applying to the BA in Music or BA in Dance should contact the respective departments for information on earlier deadlines and audition requirements.
*   **Transfer applicants** interested in programs such as Art BFA, Athletic Training, Dance BA/BFA, Narrative Production, Interior Design BFA, Industrial Design BS, Music BA/BM, Nursing, and Social Work must adhere to earlier departmental deadlines and may need to submit additional information.

**Graduate business programs** require several supplementary materials, including a résumé, two letters of recommendation, a short answer essay, and a video statement of purpose.

**Veterans** of the United States armed forces should submit their discharge papers (Form DD 214).
application_data.additional_deadlines:
### Additional Deadlines at California State University, Long Beach

Beyond the initial application, California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) has several other important deadlines for students concerning financial aid, scholarships, and housing.

**Financial Aid Deadlines:**
Students seeking financial aid for the 2026-2027 academic year should submit their Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) or California Dream Act Application (CADAA) by March 2, 2026. For the 2025-2026 academic year, the priority application deadline was April 2, 2025. While applications for 2025-2026 are still accepted until June 30, 2026, those who missed the priority deadline may not be eligible for certain types of state and university aid.

**Scholarship Application Periods:**
CSULB offers various scholarship opportunities with different application windows:
*   **BeachScholarships:**
    *   For Spring 2026: Apply between August 18 - September 29, 2025.
    *   For Fall 2026: Apply between January 20 - March 2, 2026.
*   **College of Business Scholarships:** The application period is from late August through September.
*   **College of Education Scholarships:** The scholarship cycle opens in January and closes in March.
*   **CSU Systemwide Scholarships:** The application season for these scholarships is from February to April.

**Housing Deadlines:**
For students planning to live on campus, the following housing application deadlines are in effect:
*   **Fall 2025:**
    *   The housing application for new applicants opens on April 2nd at 10 AM PST.
    *   The priority deadline for housing applications is May 1st.
    *   Current returning residents have an earlier application window from March 19th to March 21st.
*   **Spring 2026:**
    *   The housing application opens on October 29, 2025, at 10 AM.
    *   The priority deadline for Spring housing is November 20th at 5 PM.

**Graduate Application Deadlines:**
The application window for students planning to graduate begins the year before their expected graduation term and concludes during the fall or spring term preceding their graduation date. For instance, the application period for students graduating in the Spring is from March 2nd to October 15th of the preceding year.

**Fee Payment Deadlines:**
The pre-semester payment deadline for Spring 2026 is January 7, 2026. For students who register after this date, fees are due the next day. For those who registered between April 7 and June 30, 2025, there was a specific deadline to make a deposit, accept financial aid, or pay tuition in full.
application_data.tuition_fees:
Undergraduate (Full-Time): ~$8,342 per year (Resident), ~$20,360 per year (Non-Resident/Supplemental Tuition).
Graduate (Full-Time): ~$9,952 per year (Resident), ~$17,944 per year (Non-Resident/Supplemental Tuition).

**Evidence:**

The tuition and fees are explicitly stated on the following pages of the California State University, Long Beach website:

*   **Undergraduate Fees:** [https://www.csulb.edu/student-records/tuition-and-fees](https://www.csulb.edu/student-records/tuition-and-fees) (Under the "California Resident Undergraduate Fees (2025-2026)" a full-time student's fees are listed as $4,171.00 per semester, which totals $8,342 per year).
*   **Undergraduate Non-Resident Tuition:** [https://www.csulb.edu/financial-aid/undergraduate-costs](https://www.csulb.edu/financial-aid/undergraduate-costs) (The "2025 - 2026 Cost of Attendance for Non-California Residents" shows $8,342 for Tuition and Mandatory Fees plus $12,018 for Non-Resident Tuition, totaling $20,360).
*   **Graduate Fees:** [https://www.csulb.edu/financial-aid/cost-of-attendance-for-standard-graduate-programs](https://www.csulb.edu/financial-aid/cost-of-attendance-for-standard-graduate-programs) (The "2025 - 2026 Cost of Attendance for California Residents" lists "Tuition and Mandatory Fees" as $9,952).
*   **Graduate Non-Resident Tuition:** [https://www.csulb.edu/financial-aid/cost-of-attendance-for-standard-graduate-programs](https://www.csulb.edu/financial-aid/cost-of-attendance-for-standard-graduate-programs) (The "2025 - 2026 Cost of Attendance for Non-California Residents" lists "Tuition and Mandatory Fees" of $9,952 and "Non-Resident Tuition" of $7,992, for a total of $17,944).

student_statistics_data.ug_scholarship_high:
**CSU Trustees' Award for Outstanding Achievement: Up to $20,000**

The highest undergraduate scholarship available to students at California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) is the CSU Trustees' Award for Outstanding Achievement, which can provide an award of up to $20,000. This scholarship is part of a system-wide program available to students at all 23 California State University campuses.

The highest scoring recipient in the CSU system is designated as the Trustee Emeritus Ali C. Razi Scholar and receives a $20,000 scholarship. Other scholarships awarded under this program include the Reed Scholarship and the Stauffer Foundation Scholarship at $15,000, and the Hampton and Barhorst Scholarships at $12,000. While the majority of the 22 scholarships awarded are for $7,000, CSULB students are eligible to compete for these higher award amounts. The awards recognize students who have overcome adversity, demonstrated financial need, and have a record of superior academic performance, personal accomplishments, and community service.

Another significant scholarship at the university is the President's Scholarship, which is described as the most prestigious merit-based scholarship awarded by CSULB. However, an explicit monetary value for this scholarship is not currently stated on the university's official website.

boolean_fields_data.is_multiple_applications_allowed:
**Application Policy at California State University, Long Beach Restricts Applicants to a Single Program per Term**

**Long Beach, CA** - Prospective students applying to California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) are permitted to submit only one application to a single program per intake term. This policy, enforced through the centralized Cal State Apply portal, prohibits applicants from concurrently applying to multiple programs, such as Data Science and Computer Science, for the same academic start date.

According to the Cal State Apply Applicant Help Center, the system explicitly states, "You can't apply to more than one program at the same campus during the same term." This regulation is further corroborated in the Cal State Apply Transfer Application Guide, which provides the same directive to potential applicants.

This restriction means that applicants must carefully consider their primary field of interest before submitting their application to CSULB. The university does not offer a mechanism for simultaneous applications to different departments or majors within the same application cycle.

For applicants interested in multiple areas of study, the policy necessitates a strategic decision to select the single program that best aligns with their academic and career goals at the time of application.

### Application Policy Details:

**Allowed:** False

**Restrictions:** A single applicant is permitted to submit an application to only one program per campus for the same intake term.

**Evidence_URL:** https://help.liaisonedu.com/Cal_State_Apply_Applicant_Help_Center/Starting_Your_Cal_State_Apply_Application/Getting_Started_with_Your_Cal_State_Apply_Application/3_Cal_State_Apply_Quick_Start_Information_and_FAQs

**Quote:** "You can't apply to more than one program at the same campus during the same term."
boolean_fields_data.is_act_required:
False
**Evidence:**
The California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) official website explicitly states that entrance exams such as the ACT and SAT are no longer required for college admission. On a page titled "Entrance Exams," the university declares, "Entrance exams are no longer required for college admission". This information is reiterated on the "Frequently Asked Questions" page, which states, "CSULB has waived the SAT/ACT requirement for all first-time Freshmen applicants."
boolean_fields_data.is_analytical_optional:
California State University, Long Beach, has discontinued its Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement Placement Examination (GPE) as of April 2025. Consequently, the associated GWAR courses (301A and Portfolio courses) are no longer mandatory beginning in the summer of 2025. While these courses may still be available as electives, the removal of the compulsory placement exam and required coursework effectively makes the formal "analytical writing" assessment optional for students.

Previously, all undergraduate students were required to take the GPE to assess their writing skills and determine if they needed to take additional writing courses to meet the Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement (GWAR). This placement exam was a requirement for all students, including transfer students, to ensure they met the university's writing standards. However, with the discontinuation of the GPE, this mandatory analytical writing assessment is no longer in place.
boolean_fields_data.is_english_optional:
False

Evidence:
The California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) website explicitly states that demonstrating English language proficiency is a requirement for all applicants. While there are specific conditions under which this requirement can be waived, the test is not optional for all international students. The California State University (CSU) system, of which CSULB is a part, also mandates that international students who have not had three years of their secondary education taught in English must provide proof of English proficiency.

The waiver conditions provided by CSULB include:
*   Holding a bachelor's or master's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution.
*   Being an undergraduate transfer or second bachelor applicant with a certain number of transferable units from a domestic U.S. institution.
*   Being a first-year student applicant who has completed at least three years at a U.S. high school.
*   Being a first-year student applicant from a U.S. regionally accredited institution abroad, provided all three years were completed at that institution.
*   Having been educated in a country that qualifies for an English waiver.

The official university website where this information is stated is: https://www.csulb.edu/student-affairs/center-for-international-education/english-language-requirement

boolean_fields_data.is_gmat_required:
True.

While a GMAT or GRE score is not required for all graduate programs at California State University, Long Beach, it is a requirement for admission into certain programs. Therefore, the statement that the GMAT is required for the university is true in the context of specific graduate school applicants.

For instance, the Evening MBA program and the Master of Science in Marketing Analytics program, both within the College of Business, explicitly state that a GMAT or GRE score is required for admission, although waivers are available for applicants who meet certain criteria. The Master of Science in Information Systems program, however, does not list the GMAT as a requirement.

**Evidence:**

The GMAT/GRE requirement is explicitly mentioned on the webpages for specific graduate programs within the College of Business at California State University, Long Beach. While a direct link to a single page stating a university-wide requirement is not available because the requirement is program-dependent, the program-specific pages serve as evidence that the GMAT is a requirement for certain fields of study at the university. Interested applicants should consult the admission requirements for their specific program of interest on the official university website, www.csulb.edu.
boolean_fields_data.is_ielts_required:
False
Evidence: The California State University, Long Beach official website states that the English language proficiency requirement can be waived for applicants who meet certain criteria, such as obtaining a bachelor's or master's degree from a U.S. regionally accredited institution or having completed at least three years at a U.S. high school. This indicates that an IELTS score is not required for all international students for every program.
URL: https://www.csulb.edu/admissions/english-language-requirement
boolean_fields_data.is_pte_required:
**False**

Evidence: A comprehensive review of the official California State University, Long Beach website (www.csulb.edu) does not explicitly state that the Pearson Test of English (PTE) is an accepted English language proficiency examination for admission. The university's web pages concerning English language requirements consistently list the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), and in some cases, the Duolingo English Test as acceptable options. There is no mention of the PTE exam in the relevant sections for international applicants.
boolean_fields_data.is_sat_required:
False
Evidence: The California State University (CSU) system, which includes California State University, Long Beach, has temporarily suspended the use of SAT or ACT scores for determining admission eligibility for all CSU campuses. This policy is in effect for fall 2023, winter 2024, and spring 2024 admission cycles. More information can be found on the official California State University admissions website: https://www.calstate.edu/apply/freshman/Pages/first-time-freshman-guidance.aspx
